description: a(n) = sum of base-6 digits of a(n-1) + sum of base-6 digits of a(n-2).
comments: The digital sum analog (in base 6) of the Fibonacci recurrence. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 27 2007a(n) == A004090(n) (modulo 5), where A004090(n) is the digital sum of Fib(n). - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 27 2007For general bases p>2, we have the inequality 2<=a(n)<=2p-3 (for n>2). Actually, a(n)<=9=A131319(6) for the base p=6. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 27 2007a(n) and Fib(n)=A000045(n) are congruent modulo 5 which implies that (a(n) mod 5) is equal to (Fib(n) mod 5) = A082116(n) (for n>0). Thus (a(n) mod 6) is periodic with the Pisano period A001175(5)=20. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 27 2007

formula: Periodic from n=3 with period 20. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Mar 13 2006a(n) = a(n-1)+a(n-2)-5*(floor(a(n-1)/6)+floor(a(n-2)/6)). - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 27 2007a(n) = floor(a(n-1)/6)+floor(a(n-2)/6)+(a(n-1)mod 6)+(a(n-2)mod 6). - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 27 2007a(n) = (a(n-1)+a(n-2)+5*(A010875(a(n-1))+A010875(a(n-2))))/6. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 27 2007a(n) = Fib(n)-5*sum{1<k<n, Fib(n-k+1)*floor(a(k)/6)} where Fib(n)=A000045(n). - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 27 2007
